turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Eastern Bloc.
turn.1: What were the Soviet Union's pre-war measures?
turn.2: Before World War II, the Soviet Union used draconian procedures to ensure compliance with directives to invest all assets in state planned manners, including the collectivisation of agriculture and utilising a sizeable labor army collected in the gulag system.
turn.3: Did they take any other measures?
turn.4: This system was largely imposed on other Eastern Bloc countries after World War II.
turn.5: What else is interesting about the pre-war measures?
turn.6: While propaganda of proletarian improvements accompanied systemic changes, terror and intimidation of the consequent ruthless Stalinism obfuscated feelings of any purported benefits.
turn.7: Why were they so rigid in their measures?
turn.8: Stalin felt that socioeconomic transformation was indispensable to establish Soviet control, reflecting the Marxist–Leninist view that material bases, the distribution of the means of production, shaped social and political relations.
turn.9: Who were the people that were put into power?
turn.10: Moscow trained cadres were put into crucial power positions to fulfill orders regarding sociopolitical transformation.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: Elimination of the bourgeoisie's social and financial power by expropriation of landed and industrial property was accorded absolute priority.
